sentence.text: As a method it is apparently effective for removing odours from low volume , low rate gas or air streams containing a relatively high concentration of pollutants .
The inhabitants were used to the smell , which mixed in nicely with the odours from Deller 's soap factory and the mingled scents from the river .
The air stank with the odour from the stalls , now freshly stocked with herring , cod , tench and even pike as the fishing fleets took advantage of a break in the weather .
The odour of fried bacon surrounded him , and a dirty plate and cutlery , pushed to the corner of the table , showed that Albert had just finished his evening meal .
He was passing the open door , caught the odour of cigarette smoke .
The bitter stench mingled with the odour of putrescent flesh and he almost retched again but found that there was nothing left to bring up .
She fell back hard against the wall and shut her eyes , her head full of the young man 's odour .
Patrick had drown up in the tenements and immediately recognized their peculiar odour -- the smell of cabbage and urine , of burnt food and unwashed humanity .
A few of the males may then mimic the female 's odour .
He found its heavy odour suffocating .
We use a vast range of soaps and deodorants to attack our bodies , particularly those areas containing apocrine glands , in an often vain attempt to eliminate these odours .
It is also affected by diet and people who regularly eat the same foods develop similar odours .
Recently there has been an increase in the use of mobile fried-fish vans which cause odours in many places , and these are not easily controlled .
The manufacturers of these products recognise this suggesting it is nevertheless possible to reduce such odours to an acceptable level without neutralising them completely .
Sometimes I smell that odour as a perfume on women , like sweet Harpic .
For the first time she could smell the dankness and the odour of rotting seaweed .
It is often possible for offensive odours to be controlled indirectly through various statutes , other than the Public Health legislation .
Locals in one area for example became accustomed to pungent odours , which can arise from the manufacture of mushroom compost if the mix is not correct , and did not complain .
The room smelt stale and musty with the pungent odour of the fat tallow candles placed on the desk .
This door was always kept closed so that the strong odours of tobacco , cigarettes , cigars , and leather goods should not permeate into the sweet shop .
The guinea pigs were sensitized to an antigen by having it injected into them , and they were simultaneously exposed to a strong odour .
There was an overpoweringly strong odour of stale tobacco smoke , and beneath that , other smells which were alien to her nostrils and which she could not identify .
If the property has been lived in for a long time with old carpets that have never been shampooed they can exude quite pungent odours .
The stewardess came down the aisle , a big-breasted young woman exuding a strong odour of perspiration .
Enhancing its startling effect this ` forked tongue " also gives off an unpleasant , pungent odour .
The warm , tropical earth gave off the sweet , pungent odour of mingled bloom and decay , and the leaves rustled like independent creatures .
Salmon can recognise their relatives by smell , showing that each population has a genetically distinct odour .
However , do notice whether there is a lingering odour of cooked food at other times .

She lay down on her back again , almost smelling the sharp odour of the whisky ; just awake enough to resist it , just sleepy enough not to make the climb out into the cold worth it , and felt numb with fear .
